metadata.Title: CVE-2022-43680 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In libexpat through 2.4.9, there is a use-after free caused by overeagerdestruction of a shared DTD in XML_ExternalEntityParserCreate inout-of-memory situations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-43680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm7
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm7
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm7').
